description:
When any living room light changes state, adjust the Office Wled brightness based on time of day. Between 06:00 and 18:00, if the Office Wled is below 50% brightness, brighten it to 70%. Between 18:00 and 06:00, if the living room light is above 60% and the Office Wled is on, dim the Office Wled to 30%. The automation waits 2 seconds between evaluation and action, and if the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, it does nothing.

Note: You clarified that the target device is “Office Wled”, which corresponds to the light named “Office” (entity_id: light.wled). The living room light present in your system is “Living Room ” (entity_id: light.living_room_2). Both are currently reported as unavailable in the provided context, so this YAML assumes they will be available at runtime.

Example Home Assistant automation (YAML):

```yaml
alias: Office Wled – Follow Living Room Brightness by Time
mode: single
trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.living_room_2

variables:
  office_entity: light.wled
  living_entity: light.living_room_2
  # Convert HA brightness (0–255) to percent
  office_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  living_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  is_daytime: >-
    {{ now().hour >= 6 and now().hour < 18 }}

condition: []

action:
  - delay: "00:00:02"  # wait 2 seconds before evaluating

  - choose:
      # Daytime logic: if Office Wled < 50%, brighten to 70%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ is_daytime }}"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct < 50 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 70% of 255 ≈ 179
              brightness: 179

      # Nighttime logic: if living room > 60% and Office Wled is on, dim to 30%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ not is_daytime }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ living_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ living_brightness_pct > 60 }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct != 30 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 30% of 255 ≈ 77
              brightness: 77

  # If conditions are not met, nothing happens (Office Wled stays as-is)
```

Key notes:
- Uses your clarified device: Office Wled (friendly name: "Office").
- Uses the only available living room light: "Living Room ".
- Avoids unnecessary commands by checking if the Office Wled is already near the target brightness before changing it.
trigger_summary: Any state change of "Living Room " (light.living_room_2) triggers a 2-second-delayed check of time of day and brightness levels.
action_summary: Daytime (06:00–18:00): if "Office" (Office Wled) is below 50% brightness, it is brightened to ~70%. Nighttime (18:00–06:00): if "Living Room " is on and brighter than 60%, "Office" is dimmed to ~30%. If the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, no action is taken.

openai_response.description:
When any living room light changes state, adjust the Office Wled brightness based on time of day. Between 06:00 and 18:00, if the Office Wled is below 50% brightness, brighten it to 70%. Between 18:00 and 06:00, if the living room light is above 60% and the Office Wled is on, dim the Office Wled to 30%. The automation waits 2 seconds between evaluation and action, and if the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, it does nothing.

Note: You clarified that the target device is “Office Wled”, which corresponds to the light named “Office” (entity_id: light.wled). The living room light present in your system is “Living Room ” (entity_id: light.living_room_2). Both are currently reported as unavailable in the provided context, so this YAML assumes they will be available at runtime.

Example Home Assistant automation (YAML):

```yaml
alias: Office Wled – Follow Living Room Brightness by Time
mode: single
trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.living_room_2

variables:
  office_entity: light.wled
  living_entity: light.living_room_2
  # Convert HA brightness (0–255) to percent
  office_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  living_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  is_daytime: >-
    {{ now().hour >= 6 and now().hour < 18 }}

condition: []

action:
  - delay: "00:00:02"  # wait 2 seconds before evaluating

  - choose:
      # Daytime logic: if Office Wled < 50%, brighten to 70%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ is_daytime }}"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct < 50 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 70% of 255 ≈ 179
              brightness: 179

      # Nighttime logic: if living room > 60% and Office Wled is on, dim to 30%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ not is_daytime }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ living_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ living_brightness_pct > 60 }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct != 30 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 30% of 255 ≈ 77
              brightness: 77

  # If conditions are not met, nothing happens (Office Wled stays as-is)
```

Key notes:
- Uses your clarified device: Office Wled (friendly name: "Office").
- Uses the only available living room light: "Living Room ".
- Avoids unnecessary commands by checking if the Office Wled is already near the target brightness before changing it.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Any state change of "Living Room " (light.living_room_2) triggers a 2-second-delayed check of time of day and brightness levels.
openai_response.action_summary: Daytime (06:00–18:00): if "Office" (Office Wled) is below 50% brightness, it is brightened to ~70%. Nighttime (18:00–06:00): if "Living Room " is on and brighter than 60%, "Office" is dimmed to ~30%. If the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, no action is taken.

openai_response.description:
A more refined version of the same behavior that also adds smooth fading transitions for the Office Wled and protects against acting while it’s unavailable. During the day (06:00–18:00), when the living room light changes and the Office Wled is below 50%, the Office Wled gently fades up to 70% over 1 second. At night (18:00–06:00), if the living room light is above 60% and the Office Wled is on, it gently dims to 30% over 1 second. The automation again waits 2 seconds after the living room change before acting, does nothing if the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, and skips actions entirely if the Office Wled is currently unavailable.

This variant builds directly on your clarification that the target device is Office Wled, and it uses its RGB/flash capabilities minimally (one advanced touch) while focusing primarily on brightness control.

Example Home Assistant automation (YAML):

```yaml
alias: Office Wled – Time‑Aware Fading with Living Room
mode: restart
trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.living_room_2

variables:
  office_entity: light.wled
  living_entity: light.living_room_2
  office_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if states(office_entity) not in ['unavailable', 'unknown'] and
          state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  living_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  is_daytime: >-
    {{ now().hour >= 6 and now().hour < 18 }}

condition:
  # Don’t run if Office Wled is unavailable
  - condition: template
    value_template: "{{ states(office_entity) not in ['unavailable', 'unknown'] }}"

action:
  - delay: "00:00:02"  # wait 2 seconds before adjusting

  - choose:
      # Daytime: fade up to 70% if below 50%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ is_daytime }}"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct < 50 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              brightness: 179   # ~70%
              transition: 1

      # Nighttime: fade down to 30% if living room > 60% and Office is on
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ not is_daytime }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ living_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ living_brightness_pct > 60 }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            # Skip if already at ~30% to avoid redundant calls
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct < 25 or office_brightness_pct > 35 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              brightness: 77    # ~30%
              transition: 1

  # Optional: brief flash if Office Wled was off and gets turned on during the day
  - choose:
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ is_daytime }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            state: "on"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              flash: short
```

Why this enhancement is useful for a single occupant:
- Fading transitions feel less jarring when you’re working at a desk.
- Skipping actions when the Office Wled is unavailable avoids unnecessary errors.
- The optional short flash during daytime gives you a subtle visual cue that the automation reacted to a living room change, without significantly altering your chosen brightness.
openai_response.trigger_summary: Any state change of "Living Room " (light.living_room_2) starts a 2-second-delayed, time-aware check of both lights.
openai_response.action_summary: If Office Wled ("Office") is available: Daytime — if it’s below 50% brightness, gently fade it to ~70%. Nighttime — if "Living Room " is on and brighter than 60%, and "Office" is on, gently fade it to ~30%. Optionally, when it turns on during the day, perform a brief flash as feedback. If already near the target brightness, no change is made.

If the Office WLED is already at the target brightness, do nothing. Wait 2 seconds between each check and action.

technical_prompt.alias: When any living room light changes state, adjust the Office Wled brightness based on time of day. Be
technical_prompt.description:
When any living room light changes state, adjust the Office Wled brightness based on time of day. Between 06:00 and 18:00, if the Office Wled is below 50% brightness, brighten it to 70%. Between 18:00 and 06:00, if the living room light is above 60% and the Office Wled is on, dim the Office Wled to 30%. The automation waits 2 seconds between evaluation and action, and if the Office Wled is already at the target brightness, it does nothing.

Note: You clarified that the target device is “Office Wled”, which corresponds to the light named “Office” (entity_id: light.wled). The living room light present in your system is “Living Room ” (entity_id: light.living_room_2). Both are currently reported as unavailable in the provided context, so this YAML assumes they will be available at runtime.

Example Home Assistant automation (YAML):

```yaml
alias: Office Wled – Follow Living Room Brightness by Time
mode: single
trigger:
  - platform: state
    entity_id: light.living_room_2

variables:
  office_entity: light.wled
  living_entity: light.living_room_2
  # Convert HA brightness (0–255) to percent
  office_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(office_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  living_brightness_pct: >-
    {% if state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') is not none %}
      {{ (state_attr(living_entity, 'brightness') | float(0) / 255 * 100) | round(0) }}
    {% else %}
      0
    {% endif %}
  is_daytime: >-
    {{ now().hour >= 6 and now().hour < 18 }}

condition: []

action:
  - delay: "00:00:02"  # wait 2 seconds before evaluating

  - choose:
      # Daytime logic: if Office Wled < 50%, brighten to 70%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ is_daytime }}"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct < 50 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 70% of 255 ≈ 179
              brightness: 179

      # Nighttime logic: if living room > 60% and Office Wled is on, dim to 30%
      - conditions:
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ not is_daytime }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ living_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ living_brightness_pct > 60 }}"
          - condition: state
            entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            state: "on"
          - condition: template
            value_template: "{{ office_brightness_pct != 30 }}"
        sequence:
          - service: light.turn_on
            target:
              entity_id: "{{ office_entity }}"
            data:
              # 30% of 255 ≈ 77
              brightness: 77

  # If conditions are not met, nothing happens (Office Wled stays as-is)
```

Key notes:
- Uses your clarified device: Office Wled (friendly name: "Office").
- Uses the only available living room light: "Living Room ".
- Avoids unnecessary commands by checking if the Office Wled is already near the target brightness before changing it.
